intro: Galium trifidum subsp. distentum, commonly known as the broad-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, trifid (three-lobed) leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild astringent properties.
